content: sarah bear crafts dvorak headband this is a simple lace headband to help you learn how to read a lace chart by sarah burghardt abram materials 50 yards worsted-weight yarn needles us 7 or size to obtain gauge notions yarn needle 2 buttons that can fit into a yarn-over space gauge 18 sts by 26 row = 4 in pattern abbreviations ssk = slip 2 sts knitwise one at a time from co = cast on the left to right needle slip them purlwise st s = stitch es back to the left needle and knit them together k = knit through the back loop p = purl k2tog = knit 2 sts together yo = yarn over wrap yarn over right-hand bobble = bind off needle between sts notes check out the video i made for reading gauge is not particularly important you lace charts can measure as you go you can even try a https //tinyurl com/asmlacecharts different weight yarn instructions co 20 sts knit 6 row of garter stitch knit every stitch every side work the chart or refer to the written instructions repeat row 1-8 until it reaches your desired length to wrap around your head finish with 6 row of garter stitch bobble row 1 rs k3 p1 k3 k2tog yo k2 yo ssk k3 p1 k3 20 sts row 2 ws k4 p12 k4 row 3 k3 p1 k2 k2tog yo k4 yo ssk k2 p1 k3 row 4 k4 p12 k4 row 5 k3 p1 k1 k2tog yo k2 p2 k2 yo ssk k1 p1 k3 row 6 k4 p5 k2 p5 k4 row 7 k3 p1 k2tog yo k3 p2 k3 yo ssk p1 k3 row 8 k4 p12 k4
